column1: Ylöjärvi (Finnish pronunciation: [ˈyløjærʋi]) is a town and a municipality in the Pirkanmaa region
column2: 14 kilometres (9 mi) west of Tampere and 189 kilometres (117 mi) north of Finland's capital city Helsinki.

column1: The town has a population of 33
column2: 264 (31 July 2020) and covers an area of 1
column3: 324.14 square kilometres (511.25 sq mi) of which 208.62 km2 (80.55 sq mi) is water. The population density is 29.82 inhabitants per square kilometre (77.2/sq mi). The population has increased rapidly in recent years

column1: The municipality of Viljakkala was consolidated with Ylöjärvi on January 1
column2: 2007. The municipality of Kuru was consolidated with Ylöjärvi on January 1

column1: Ylöjärvi was founded as a municipality in 1869. Starting January 1
column3: it is known as a town. The Finnish Museum of Refrigeration also locates at Ylöjärvi.

column1: The famous rock band Eppu Normaali comes from Ylöjärvi.
The town is the location of Tree Mountain
column2: Land Art by Agnes Denes.  This work was conceived in 1983
column3: and construction was announced by the Finnish government at the 1992 Earth Summit.  Construction was complete in 1996
column4: and the site is legally protected for the next 400 years.

column1: Tree Mountain was dedicated in June 1996 by the President of Finland.
